turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: You're Alan Grant, aren't you?  I read both of your books.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Which one do you prefer?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: The first one. Before you where on the island. You liked dinosaurs back then.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Back then, they hadn't tried to eat me.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: When InGen cleared out, they left a lot of stuff behind.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Any weapons, radios?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Found this, but the battery's dead.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: It's a wonder you aren't. I'm amazed, Eric. I barely lasted 30 hours. You lasted eight weeks.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Is that all it's been? I thought it was longer.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: The important thing is we both made it. That's something we have in common.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Did you read Malcolm's book?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: What did you think?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: I dunno. I mean, it was kind of preachy. Chaos-this, chaos-that. And like, to me, the guy seemed kind of high on himself.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Know what this is?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: A raptor claw. I use to have one. A fossil.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Mine's new.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: How much of this island have you explored?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: I stayed pretty close to the compound, Figured if anyone came to look for me, that's where they'd start.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: We need to head for the coast.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Are you sure?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Closer you get to the water, the bigger things get.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: We climb down to the barge and follow the river out to the ocean. With any luck, the Costa Rican coast guard will pick us up.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Then we go home?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Do you have any kids?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: No. Although I've studied them in the wild.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: I have a theory that there's two kinds of boys. Those who want to be astronomers and those who want to be astronauts.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: I want to be an astronaut.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: See, I was the opposite. I never understood why anyone would want to go into space. It's so dangerous. You do one thing wrong and you're dead. The astronomer -- or the paleontologist -- get to study these amazing things from a place of complete safety. And truthfully, everything you really need to learn, you can learn it from the ground.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: But then you never get to go in space.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Exactly. The difference between imagining how things might be and seeing how they really are. To be able to touch them. That's what Billy wanted to do.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Bonitas.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Something must've scared them.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: The lady you called, how do you know she can help us?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: She's the one person I could always count on. And she's saved me more times than she realizes. I owe her everything.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: It's strikes me now I never told her that.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: You should.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: You're right.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Eric, do you know what happened to the boat? that brought you here? Why did it crash?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: No. I couldn't see.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Do me a favor. Go back to your parents for a minute, would you?  They look worried.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: We're safe!

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: No we're not.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: What do you think is going to happen with the dinosaurs?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: The population will Stabilize eventually. They'll adapt to fit different roles.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: What can I do for you, Mr. Kirby?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Well sir, I am a great admirer of yours, and I have an extremely interesting proposition to discuss. Would you let my wife and I take you to have dinner tonight? Our treat.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: You know, I've been traveling and I'm very tired. Maybe some other time.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I guarantee it'll be worth your while.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Hmmm.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Now, for our wedding anniversary this year we wanted to do something really special, something...

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: That's a very nice offer, Mr. Kirby, but I'm afraid I'm much to busy. If you like I can refer you to a number of highly qualified...

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: No, no, see Dr. Grant, you're the best. You've seen these animals in the flesh. No one else has come close to you.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: I'm flattered, but I've taken this little adventure tour. And with the air restrictions they've imposed after the incident in San Diego, you canÂ’t fly low enough to see anything of interest.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: That's hard to believe.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Let's just say that through my business -- imports/exports, emerging markets -- I've made some friends in high places. In this case, the Costa Rican government.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Dr. Grant if you'd just sit tight, we'll explain this all in a jiffy.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: This plane can not land!

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: What the hell is going on? What are they doing?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Establishing a perimeter. Making it safe. These guys are really good. One of them was a Green...

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Mr. Kirby, trust me, on this island, there is no such thing as safe. We have to get back in this plane...

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: We needed somebody who knew the lay of the land. Somebody who'd been to this island before.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: I have never been on this island!

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Sure you have. You wrote that book...

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: No, I'm sorry, but no. We'll savage what we can from the plane. Then we head for the coast. There may be a boat left, something to get us off this island.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Dr. Grant, we're not leaving without our son.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: You can stick with us, or you can go and look for him. Either way you're probably not getting out of here alive.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: There is no Kirby Enterprises, is there?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: There is. I own a place called Kirby Paint and Title Plus. We're out in the Westgate Shopping Center in Enid, Oklahoma. The "plus" is for bathroom fixtures, fireplaces accessories, patio furniture. Stuff like that.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Well that's good.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: But you never came across just one.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Amanda!

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Back out! Move!

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Billy!

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: It's no use, Dr. Grant. No use.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Whatever you do, don't call the U.S. Embassy. They won't do a God Damn thing.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Well, we don't exactly have a Costa Rican phone book here, so it will have to be somebody we know in the states. Someone we can absolutely count on to send help.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Stan.

turns.speaker: AJAY
turns.text: How did you know?

turns.speaker: ROLAND
turns.text: That cheap aftershave I send you every Christmas, you actually wear it.  I'm touched.  Sit down, sit down, what brings you to Mombassa?

turns.speaker: AJAY
turns.text: You.  Tell me, Roland, when was the last time you answered your phone?

turns.speaker: ROLAND
turns.text: Last time I plugged it in, I suppose. Why?

turns.speaker: AJAY
turns.text: I got a call from a gentleman who's going to Costa Rica, or thereabouts. If he's to be believed, it's a most, uh, unique expedition.  And very well-funded.

turns.speaker: ROLAND
turns.text: Well, I'm a very well-funded old son of a bitch.  You go.

turns.speaker: AJAY
turns.text: But alone?  We always had great success together, you and I.

turns.speaker: ROLAND
turns.text: Just a little bit too much, I think.

turns.speaker: AJAY
turns.text: How do you mean?

turns.speaker: ROLAND
turns.text: A true hunter doesn't mind if the animal wins.  If it escapes.  But there weren't enough escapes from you and me, Ajay.  I've decided to spend a bit less time in the company of death.  Maybe I just feel too close to it my--

turns.speaker: ROLAND
turns.text: Sorry.  We were saying?

turns.speaker: AJAY
turns.text: You broke that idiot's jaw for no reason other than your boredom.  Tell the truth, Roland.  Aren't you even interested in knowing this expedition's quarry?

turns.speaker: ROLAND
turns.text: Ajay.  Go on up to my ranch, take a look around the trophy room, and tell me what kind of quarry you think could possibly be of any interest to me.

turns.speaker: AJAY
turns.text: It matches the pictures.

turns.speaker: ROLAND
turns.text: It certainly does.

turns.speaker: AJAY
turns.text: Make a blind here?  Wait for the buck to return?

turns.speaker: ROLAND
turns.text: If the nest is upwind, so are we. When he comes back, he'll know we're here before we have a chance.  The truck --

turns.speaker: ROLAND
turns.text: You hear something?

turns.speaker: AJAY
turns.text: No.  I feel something.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Any damage?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Minimal.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: "Minimal" is too much.   It has to be light, it has to be strong --

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Light and strong, light and strong, sure, why not, it's only impossible. God save me from academics.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: You are an academic.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Former academic.  Now I actually make things.  I don't just talk.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: You think I'm all talk, Eddie?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: It doesn't matter what I think.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Is there anything we've forgotten? Anything at all?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Is there an antidote?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Like if you shoot yourself in the foot?  Wouldn't matter.  You'd be dead  before you realized you'd accidentally pulled the trigger.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Why didn't you tell us about these guys, Ian?!

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Because I didn't know!  I don't have the faintest idea what they're doing here.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Resentful.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: When you have a lot of time to think, it's funny who you remember.  It's the people who challenged you.  It is the quality of our opponents that gives our accomplishments meaning.  I never told you how sorry I was about what happened after we returned.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: I didn't know you -- weren't well.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: It's the lawyers.  The lawyers are finally killing me.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: They do have motives.  Why did you want to see me?  Your message said it was urgent.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: You were right -- and I was wrong. There!  Did you ever think you'd hear me say that?  Spectacularly wrong. Instead of observing those animals, I tried to control them.  I squandered an opportunity and we still know next to nothing about their lives.  Not their lives as man would have them, behind electric fences, but in the wild.  Behavior in their natural habitat, the impossible dream of any paleontologist.  I could have had it, but I let it slip away.  Thank God for Site B.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Well?  Didn't it all seem a trifle compact to you?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: The hatchery, in particular?  You know my initial yields had to be low, far less than one percent, that's a thousand embryos for every single live birth.  Genetic engineering on that scale implies a giant operation, not the spotless little laboratory I showed you.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: I don't believe you.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Isla Nublar was just a showroom, Ian, something for the tourists, Site B was the factory floor.  We built it first, on Isla Sorna, eight-some miles from Nublar.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: No, no, no, no, no, no . . .

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: After the accident at the park, a hurricane wiped out our facility on Site B.  We had to evacuate and leave the animals to fend for themselves. And they did.  For four years I've fought to keep them safe from human meddling, now I want you to go there and document them.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Are you out of your mind?  I still have nightmares, my reputation's a joke, my leg is shot -- you think I need more of that?

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: It would be the most extraordinary living fossil record the world has ever seen.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: So what?

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: I've been putting this together for over a year.  I have personal suggestions for your entire team, phone numbers, contact people.  They won't believe you about what they're going to see, so don't bother trying to convince them.  Just use my checkbook to get them there. I'll fund your expedition through my personal accounts, as such money and equipment as you need, but only if you leave immediately.  If we hesitate, all will be lost.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: John . . .

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: You'll need an animal behaviorist, someone with unimpeachable credentials.  I believe you already know Sarah Harding.  She's got theories about parenting and nurturing among hunter/scavengers I bet she'd be dying to prove on a scale like this.  If you convince her to go, it'll be a major coup.  When she publishes, the scientific community must take it seriously.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: I'm not going, John.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Ian, you are my last chance to give something of real value to the world. I can't walk so far and leave no footprints; die and leave nothing with my name on it.  I will not  be known only for my failures.  And you will not allow yourself to go down in history as a lunatic.  You're too smart.  You'e too proud.  Dr. Malcolm.  Please.  This is a chance at redemption.  For both of us. There's no time to equivocate, we must seize it now, before --

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Oh --

turns.speaker: JUTTSON
turns.text: Do you have chromium tapes?  The others fog in high-

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: -humidity, I know.  Highest lead density on the market.

turns.speaker: JUTTSON
turns.text: InGen is a genetics corporation, isn't it?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Is that who we're really working for?!  Gene splicers?!

turns.speaker: JUTTSON
turns.text: But he's the head of InGen!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: You gotta be kidding.  You dragged me out of Greenpeace to be a corporate stooge?  You couldn't get anybody else?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Are you looking for a problem?

turns.speaker: JUTTSON
turns.text: Everyone, keep your voices down!

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: That was a pair bond!  A family group, even, long after that infant was nestbound!

turns.speaker: JUTTSON
turns.text: I want to see the nesting ground!

turns.speaker: JUTTSON
turns.text: The empty shells are crushed and trampled.  The young stay in the birth environment, that's conclusive!

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Not without a shot of the nest.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Ian, you're not insane!  I'm so glad!

turns.speaker: JUTTSON
turns.text: Dr. Malcolm -- the world -- owes you an apology.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: And let's forget about the high hide. We can't do this kind of work up in a tower, we need to be out in the field, as close to the animals as possible.

turns.speaker: JUTTSON
turns.text: I'm not surprised stegosaur lived in a family group, but there's never been anything in the fossil record to prove the carnivores did.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Why wouldn't they?  Look at hyenas, jackals, nearly all species of predator birds --

turns.speaker: JUTTSON
turns.text: That doesn't say a thing about T-rex, they could have been rogues.  Robert Burke certainly thinks they were.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: We've got to see one to find out. Is there any --

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Hi, Dad.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Kelly!  What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Okay, Karen is expecting you in half an hour.  You only have to stay with her one night, she'll put you on a bus in the morning and your mother will be at the station when you get there.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I don't even know this woman.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Well, I do, and she's fantastic. She'll take you to the museum, maybe to a movie if you play your cards right.  You're going to have a fantastic time.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Stop saying fantastic.  Where are you going?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: I can't tell you.  But I'll be back within a week.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: My vacation is over in a week.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: I'll make it up to you this summer. I promise.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I'm your daughter all the time, you know.  Not just when it's convenient.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Very hurtful.  Your mother tell you to say that?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: No, Dad.  I have thoughts of my own once in a while.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Is that kid still bothering you?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Which one?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: You know, at the bus stop.  With the hair?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: That was about a year ago.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Well, is he?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: No.  Richard talked to his parents.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: That Richard.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I could come with you.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Out of the question.  You'd miss the gymnastics trials.  You've been training for that for a year.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I don't care about the trials, I want to be with you.  I could be your research assistant, like I was in Austin.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: This is nothing like Austin.  Forget about it.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: You like to have kids, you just don't want to be with them, do you?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: How could you possibly?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Because you said so.  Maybe nobody else believed you, but I always did.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: "InGen."  What's InGen?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Where does it say that?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: On the side of that one truck.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: What are you guys gonna do?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Exactly what John Hammond wanted us to do.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Are you all right?!  Anything broken?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I'm fine, I'm fine, I was scared, I thought you, are you okay?!

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: I'm fine... I'm fine...

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Dad!

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Come on!

turns.speaker: ROLAND
turns.text: Cancel that, Dieter.

turns.speaker: LUDLOW
turns.text: What?  Why?

turns.speaker: ROLAND
turns.text: Carnivores hunt near stream beds.  Do you want to set up base camp or an all-you-can-eat people bar?

turns.speaker: LUDLOW
turns.text: You heard his, Dieter.  Find a new spot.  And remember, we're after herbivores only -- no unnecessary risks.

turns.speaker: ROLAND
turns.text: Peter, if you want me to run your little camping trip, there are two conditions.  First -- I'm in charge, and when I'm not around, Dieter is.  Your job is to sign the checks, tell us we're doing a good job, and open your case of scotch when we have a good day.  Second condition -- my fee.  You can keep it.  All I want in exchange for my services is the right to hunt one of the tyrannosaurs.  A male.  Buck only.  Why and how are my business. If you don't  like either of those conditions, you're on your own.  Go ahead and set up your camp right here, or in a swamp, or in the middle of a rex nest, for all I care.  But I've been on too many safaris with rich dentists to listen to any more suicidal ideas.  Okay?

turns.speaker: LUDLOW
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: ROLAND
turns.text: Good lad.

turns.speaker: LUDLOW
turns.text: Where do you think you're going?!

turns.speaker: ROLAND
turns.text: To collect my fee.

turns.speaker: LUDLOW
turns.text: What kind of gun is that?

turns.speaker: ROLAND
turns.text: My father's .600 Nitro Express.  Made in 1904.  Karimojo Bell gave it to him after he took down his last elephant.  8700 foot pound striking force.

turns.speaker: LUDLOW
turns.text: How close do you have to be?

turns.speaker: ROLAND
turns.text: Forty yards.  Less, maybe.  I assume it'll take a slug in the brain case to bring him down.

turns.speaker: LUDLOW
turns.text: Why not just use a scope and a poison dart and snipe him from a hill?

turns.speaker: LUDLOW
turns.text: You rally think this'll draw the parent?

turns.speaker: ROLAND
turns.text: I once saw a bull elephant die charging a jeep.  All the jeep had done was startle the bull's calves. I saw a lioness carry wounded prey four and a half miles, all the way back to its den, just to teach its cubs how to finish off a kill.

turns.speaker: LUDLOW
turns.text: Killing lessons?  Heartwarming.

turns.speaker: ROLAND
turns.text: Rex won't be any different.  It'll come.

turns.speaker: LUDLOW
turns.text: You're kidding yourself.  An adult T-rex cares about one thing -- filling its own belly.  It acts the way people wish they could, that's why everyone's fascinated by it.  If people had the chance to see one dinosaur and one only, ninety-nine percent would --

turns.speaker: ROLAND
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: LUDLOW
turns.text: I hadn't planned on bringing carnivores back because of the liability risk, but I only thought of adults, it never occurred to me --  You are a billion dollar idea, my little f-

turns.speaker: LUDLOW
turns.text: Had to.  To keep him still for the trip.

turns.speaker: ROLAND
turns.text: You've broken its leg!

turns.speaker: LUDLOW
turns.text: We've got to transport it seven thousand miles.  Would you prefer it bit off the leg of a crew member?

turns.speaker: LUDLOW
turns.text: What in Christ's name is going on?!

turns.speaker: ROLAND
turns.text: Isn't it obvious?

turns.speaker: ROLAND
turns.text: What is?

turns.speaker: LUDLOW
turns.text: The velociraptors.

turns.speaker: LUDLOW
turns.text: What is that?

turns.speaker: ROLAND
turns.text: Piss.

turns.speaker: ROLAND
turns.text: Where's the power and radio setup?

turns.speaker: LUDLOW
turns.text: Operations building.  Far end of the street.

turns.speaker: LUDLOW
turns.text: The radio rig is inside.  It runs directly from the geothermal generator, so power shouldn't be a problem.

turns.speaker: ROLAND
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: LUDLOW
turns.text: Do you think the rex might have the infant with it?

turns.speaker: ROLAND
turns.text: Possible.

turns.speaker: ROLAND
turns.text: We took to the rock.

turns.speaker: LUDLOW
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: LUDLOW
turns.text: It's... behind... us.

turns.speaker: ROLAND
turns.text: It's just fed.  It won't attack unless it's threatened.  Don't move.

turns.speaker: LUDLOW
turns.text: If I don't move, I can't shoot it.

turns.speaker: ROLAND
turns.text: Let it go, Peter.  The animal won.

turns.speaker: LUDLOW
turns.text: So, you two were just, uh, telling old campfire stories, were you?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Do me a favor.  Don't pretend for a second that you and I don't know the truth.  You can convince Time magazine and the Skeptical Inquirer of whatever you want, but I was there.

turns.speaker: LUDLOW
turns.text: You signed a non-disclosure agreement before you went to the island that expressly forbade you from discussing anything you saw.  You violated that agreement.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: You cost me my livelihood.  That on which I relied to support my children.

turns.speaker: LUDLOW
turns.text: If your university felt you were causing it embarrassment by selling wild stories to Hard Copy, I hardly see how I am to--

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: I didn't tell anything, I told the truth.

turns.speaker: LUDLOW
turns.text: You version of it.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: There are no versions of the truth! This isn't a corporate maneuver, it's my life.

turns.speaker: LUDLOW
turns.text: We made a generous compensatory offer for your injuries.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: It was a payoff and an insult.  InGen never--

turns.speaker: LUDLOW
turns.text: InGen is my livelihood, Dr. Malcolm, and I will jealously defend its interests.  People will know what I want them to know when I want them to know it.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: What's he got in there?

turns.speaker: LUDLOW
turns.text: Piss.

turns.speaker: LUDLOW
turns.text: Trespassing, sabotage -- you could go to jail just for being here, did you know that?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Don't start a legal argument with me, this island isn't your property, and neither are these animals!

turns.speaker: LUDLOW
turns.text: Their what?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Oh, God.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: LUDLOW
turns.text: Don't ask me.  The guy's completely out to lunch.

turns.speaker: LUDLOW
turns.text: You know how to work a radio, don't you?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: You're going too?

turns.speaker: LUDLOW
turns.text: I lost everything I came after on this trip, but one T-rex in one theme park could single-handedly bail InGen out of Chapter 11.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: She's gutty.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: She's nuts.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: No way.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Oh, my God.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Do you see any family resemblance here?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: You can't stay, Kelly, that's it. It's too dangerous.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Then this is our chance.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Our chance to do what?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I don't know these guys, but I know 'em.  I've seen 'em on Japanese whalers, French barges trying to dump barrels of nuclear waste in the North Atlantic.  They're all the same. They spray us with water cannon when we try to stop 'em, sink our boats, and then call us crazy.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: There' no reason for name calling.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Dr. Juttson, please take Kelly back to camp right away.  Leave the other car for us and we'll meet you there in an hour or so.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: It has a broken leg!

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: So do it a favor and put it out of its misery!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: No!  Get in the car before they hear us!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: What do they want?!

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: What do you think they want?!

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: No way.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Lava?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: What are they?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Come on!

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Where's Kelly?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: She's with Sarah!

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: We can't stay in here!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: We're sure as hell not going back out there"

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: This is single-wall construction! It's just a shack!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: It'll hold!

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: For sixty seconds, maybe!  Look at this!  You could-

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Head for the roof!

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: I have to find Kelly!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I think she's with Sarah!

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: DAMN IT, BE SURE!!

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Something's wrong.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Look!  Sarah!

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: No.  I'm quite certain you can't.

turns.speaker: ROLAND
turns.text: Look, we have two choices.  We can hike back down to the lagoon, where we can sit for two days, in the open, next to a heavily used water source while we're waiting for your boat to arrive, or we can head for the village, where we might find some shelter and we can call for help.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: We'd never make it past the raptors. Trust me, I have some experience in this matter.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: You ever heard of Gambler's Ruin?

turns.speaker: ROLAND
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: A statistical phenomenon.  Says everything in the world goes in streaks.  It's real, you see it everywhere -- in weather, in river flooding, in baseball, in blackjack, in stock markets.  Once things go bad, they tend to stay bad.  Bad things cluster.  They go to hell together.

turns.speaker: ROLAND
turns.text: Feeling a bit blue, are we?
